alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 5:33PM EDT until March 27 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 345 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 PM EDT, Minor flooding is occurring along the West Fork of Duck Creek at Macksburg. This is due to heavier rains, between 1.5 to 2 inches, from earlier in the day. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg and Lower Salem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
